intro: Czerniaevia melicoides, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant thrives in hot, dry climates and is adapted to poor soil conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
